title: Volcano, Hawaii
text:
Volcano is a <a href="census-designated%20place">census-designated place</a> (CDP) in <a href="Hawaii%20County%2C%20Hawaii">Hawaii County</a>, <a href="Hawaii">Hawaii</a>, United States located in the <a href="Puna%2C%20Hawaii">District of Puna</a> with a small portion of the CDP in the <a href="Kau%2C%20Hawaii">District of Kaū</a>. The population was 2,575 at the <a href="2010%20United%20States%20Census">2010 census</a>, up from 2,231 at the 2000 census.
Geography and climate.
Volcano is located on the east side of the island of <a href="Hawaii%20%28island%29">Hawaii</a>, on the border of <a href="Hawaii%20Volcanoes%20National%20Park">Hawaii Volcanoes National Park</a> and near the northeast rim of <a href="K%C4%ABlauea">Kīlauea</a>'s summit <a href="caldera">caldera</a>.
According to the <a href="United%20States%20Census%20Bureau">United States Census Bureau</a>, the CDP has a total area of , all of it land. <a href="Hawaii%20Route%2011">Hawaii Route 11</a> passes through the southern part of the community, leading northeast to <a href="Hilo%2C%20Hawaii">Hilo</a> and southwest to <a href="Naalehu%2C%20Hawaii">Nāālehu</a>.
Owing to its altitude, ranging from below in the southeast to over at its uninhabited northern end, Volcano features a <a href="subtropical%20highland%20climate">subtropical highland climate</a> (<a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20climate%20classification">Köppen</a> "Cfb"), with relatively uniform temperatures and abundant rainfall throughout the year, although rainfall is concentrated during the months of November through April.
Demographics.
2010 census.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2010, there were 2,575 people in 1,228 households residing in the CDP. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 45.4 people per square mile (17.5/km2). There were 1,740 housing units at an average density of 30.7 per square mile (11.9/km2). The racial makeup of the CDP was 51.53% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 0.74% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.39% <a href="Native%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">American Indian & Alaska Native</a>, 11.57% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 9.79% <a href="Pacific%20Islander%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Native Hawaiian & Pacific Islander</a>, 0.43% from <a href="Race%20%28United%20States%20Census%29">other races</a>, and 25.55% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 8.82% of the population.
There were 1,228 households, out of which 17.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them. The average household size was 2.10.
In the Volcano CDP the population was spread out, with 17.3% under the age of 18, 5.4% from 18 to 24, 8.8% from 25 to 34, 16.4% from 35 to 49, 34.6% from 50 to 64, and 17.5% who were 65 years of age or older. For every 100 females, there were 99.3 males. For every 100 males there were 100.7 females.
2000 census.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, there were 2,231 people, 896 households, and 498 families residing in the CDP. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 39.4 people per square mile (15.2/km2). There were 1,229 housing units at an average density of 21.7 per square mile (8.4/km2). The racial makeup of the CDP was 47.87% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 0.49% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.54% <a href="Native%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Native American</a>, 11.39% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 12.24% <a href="Pacific%20Islander%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Pacific Islander</a>, 1.34% from <a href="Race%20%28United%20States%20Census%29">other races</a>, and 26.13% from two or more races. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 9.28% of the population.
There were 896 households, out of which 24.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 41.4% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 9.5% had a female householder with no husband present, and 44.4% were non-families. 34.7% of all households were made up of individuals, and 7.5% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.25 and the average family size was 2.92.
In the CDP the population was spread out, with 20.3% under the age of 18, 6.7% from 18 to 24, 30.7% from 25 to 44, 30.3% from 45 to 64, and 11.9% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 41 years. For every 100 females, there were 116.2 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 125.2 males.
The median income for a household in the CDP was $35,977, and the median income for a family was $44,432. Males had a median income of $30,929 versus $31,679 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the CDP was $18,913. About 10.4% of families and 14.3% of the population were below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including 15.0% of those under age 18 and 2.3% of those age 65 or over.
